verses.kjv: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.
verses.ct: In the 18th year of King Jeroboam son of Nebat, Abijam became king over Judah.

verses.kjv: Three years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.ct: He ruled in Jerusalem for 3 years. His mother's name was Maachah, the granddaughter of Abishalom.

verses.kjv: And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as the heart of David his father.
verses.ct: He continued in all the same sins his father had committed before him. His heart was not fully devoted to the LORD his God the way his ancestor David's heart had been.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless for David’s sake did the LORD his God give him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem:
verses.ct: Even so, for David's sake, the LORD his God kept a light burning for him in Jerusalem by raising up his son to succeed him and by keeping Jerusalem secure.

verses.kjv: Because David did that which was right in the eyes of the LORD, and turned not aside from any thing that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
verses.ct: This was because David had done what was right in the LORD's judgment and never strayed from anything God commanded him throughout his entire life — except in the situation involving Uriah the Hittite.

verses.kjv: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
verses.ct: There was ongoing conflict between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout his lifetime.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
verses.ct: Everything else about Abijam's reign and all his actions are recorded in the official records of the kings of Judah. There was also war between Abijam and Jeroboam.

verses.kjv: And Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Abijam died and joined his ancestors, and they buried him in the city of David. His son Asa became king after him.

verses.kjv: And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel reigned Asa over Judah.
verses.ct: In the 20th year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa became king over Judah.

verses.kjv: And forty and one years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
verses.ct: He ruled in Jerusalem for 41 years. His grandmother's name was Maachah, the granddaughter of Abishalom.

verses.kjv: And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of the LORD, as did David his father.
verses.ct: Asa did what was right in the LORD's judgment, just as his ancestor David had done.

verses.kjv: And he took away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
verses.ct: He expelled the male shrine prostitutes from the land and got rid of all the idols that his ancestors had made.

verses.kjv: And also Maachah his mother, even her he removed from being queen, because she had made an idol in a grove; and Asa destroyed her idol, and burnt it by the brook Kidron.
verses.ct: He even removed his grandmother Maachah from her position as queen mother because she had set up a disgusting idol at an Asherah shrine. Asa cut down her idol and burned it at the Kidron brook.

verses.kjv: But the high places were not removed: nevertheless Asa’s heart was perfect with the LORD all his days.
verses.ct: Although the hilltop shrines were not torn down, Asa's heart remained fully devoted to the LORD throughout his life.

verses.kjv: And he brought in the things which his father had dedicated, and the things which himself had dedicated, into the house of the LORD, silver, and gold, and vessels.
verses.ct: He brought into the LORD's temple the items that his father had dedicated, along with things he himself had dedicated — silver, gold, and various articles.

verses.kjv: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.ct: There was constant conflict between Asa and Baasha king of Israel throughout their reigns.

verses.kjv: And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
verses.ct: Baasha king of Israel marched against Judah and fortified Ramah to block anyone from entering or leaving the territory of Asa king of Judah.

verses.kjv: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king’s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Benhadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
verses.ct: So Asa gathered all the silver and gold remaining in the treasuries of the LORD's temple and in the royal palace, handed them over to his officials, and sent them to Benhadad son of Tabrimon, son of Hezion, king of Aram, who lived in Damascus, with this message:

verses.kjv: There is a league between me and thee, and between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent unto thee a present of silver and gold; come and break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
verses.ct: "There is a treaty between you and me, just as there was between your father and my father. Look, I am sending you a gift of silver and gold. Go ahead and break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel so that he will pull back from my territory."

verses.kjv: So Benhadad hearkened unto king Asa, and sent the captains of the hosts which he had against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abelbethmaachah, and all Cinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
verses.ct: Benhadad listened to King Asa and sent his army commanders against the cities of Israel. They attacked Ijon, Dan, Abelbethmaachah, and all of Cinneroth, along with the entire region of Naphtali.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Baasha heard thereof, that he left off building of Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah.
verses.ct: When Baasha got word of this, he abandoned his construction project at Ramah and withdrew to Tirzah.

verses.kjv: Then king Asa made a proclamation throughout all Judah; none was exempted: and they took away the stones of Ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith Baasha had builded; and king Asa built with them Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
verses.ct: Then King Asa issued an order to all of Judah — no one was exempt — and they hauled away the stones and timber that Baasha had been using to build up Ramah. King Asa used those materials to fortify Geba of Benjamin and Mizpah.

verses.kjv: The rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? Nevertheless in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
verses.ct: Everything else about Asa's reign — all his accomplishments, everything he did, and the cities he built — is recorded in the official records of the kings of Judah. However, in his old age he developed a disease in his feet.

verses.kjv: And Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Asa died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of his ancestor David. His son Jehoshaphat became king after him.

verses.kjv: And Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned over Israel two years.
verses.ct: Nadab son of Jeroboam became king over Israel in the 2nd year of Asa king of Judah, and he ruled over Israel for 2 years.

verses.kjv: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the LORD's judgment, following in his father's footsteps and continuing the sin that his father had caused Israel to commit.

verses.kjv: And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel laid siege to Gibbethon.
verses.ct: Baasha son of Ahijah, from the tribe of Issachar, plotted against him. Baasha struck him down at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines, while Nadab and all Israel were besieging that city.

verses.kjv: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha slay him, and reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Baasha killed him in the 3rd year of Asa king of Judah and took the throne in his place.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he reigned, that he smote all the house of Jeroboam; he left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until he had destroyed him, according unto the saying of the LORD, which he spake by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite:
verses.ct: As soon as he became king, he wiped out Jeroboam's entire family. He did not leave a single person alive from Jeroboam's household — he destroyed them all. This fulfilled the message the LORD had spoken through his servant Ahijah the Shilonite.

verses.kjv: Because of the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made Israel sin, by his provocation wherewith he provoked the LORD God of Israel to anger.
verses.ct: This happened because of the sins Jeroboam had committed and had led Israel to commit, provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
verses.ct: Everything else about Nadab's reign and all his actions are recorded in the official records of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
verses.ct: There was constant conflict between Asa and Baasha king of Israel throughout their reigns.

verses.kjv: In the third year of Asa king of Judah began Baasha the son of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, twenty and four years.
verses.ct: In the 3rd year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha son of Ahijah became king over all Israel in Tirzah, and he ruled for 24 years.

verses.kjv: And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin wherewith he made Israel to sin.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the LORD's judgment, following in Jeroboam's footsteps and continuing the sin that Jeroboam had caused Israel to commit.
